channel.title: BBC News - Home

item.title: Donald Trump does not have presidential immunity, US court rules
item.description: The former president loses a landmark legal bid to shield him from charges of election fraud.

item.title: PM says pressure starting to ease as millions get last cost-of-living payment
item.description: As millions get a final cost of living payment, Rishi Sunak says the burden on households is subsiding.

item.title: Welsh fire service taken over after harassment probe
item.description: Welsh government effectively takes over as minister says failures could be putting lives at risk.

item.title: Constance Marten and Mark Gordon hid baby's location from police, court hears
item.description: In new footage, police officers are heard asking "where's your child?", but the couple do not reply.

item.title: Kwasi Kwarteng to stand down as Spelthorne MP
item.description: The former chancellor says it has been an "honour to serve the residents of Spelthorne since 2010".

item.title: Romance fraudster conned women out of £300k
item.description: Cieran McNamara, who admitted fraud by false representation, shared images of travel and mansions.

item.title: Tom Holland: Spider-Man actor to star in new Romeo and Juliet production
item.description: The Spider-Man actor last performed in the West End in 2008 as a child in Billy Elliot The Musical.

item.title: Facebook and Instagram to label all fake AI images
item.description: The tech will detect images - but not video or audio - made by other companies' AI generators.

item.title: Birmingham's 10% council tax rise approved amid financial crisis
item.description: The government says it will not block the increase, but that responsibility lies with the council.

item.title: Shea Gordon: Teens jailed for life after birthday party murder
item.description: Shea Gordon, 17, was stabbed just after midnight in 2022 while attending the event in east London.

item.title: Houthis claim new attacks on Red Sea shipping
item.description: The latest attacks come in defiance of repeated US and UK strikes to try to deter the group.

item.title: Paul Mackenzie: Kenyan cult leader charged with 191 murders
item.description: Paul Mackenzie, accused of starving his followers to death, pleads not guilty.

item.title: Christian Horner allegations: Hearing into complaint against Red Bull team principal set for Friday
item.description: A hearing into a complaint of inappropriate behaviour made against Red Bull Formula 1 team boss Christian Horner will take place on Friday.

item.title: The father who never gave up hope on getting justice for his stabbed son
item.description: Michael Jonas's dad reflects as the six men who killed his 17-year-old son are handed life sentences.

item.title: Love Island's Tasha Ghouri wants to normalise deaf accents
item.description: The reality TV star says the reaction to a video without her cochlear implant has been "overwhelming".

item.title: Iain Watson: Labour works on plan for power
item.description: Behind the scenes, Labour is working out how it might put its ideas into action if it wins the next general election.

item.title: Carry On films: The star who helped World War II prisoners escape
item.description: Peter Butterworth, who appeared in 16 Carry On films, was an officer for MI9 planning prison escapes.

item.title: Liz Truss targets 'secret Tories' with new campaign
item.description: The ex-PM launches Popular Conservatism to fight for right wing values, without undermining Rishi Sunak.

item.title: What's killing so many of Sri Lanka's elephants?
item.description: If deaths continue at the current rate, Sri Lanka could lose 70% of its elephants, experts say.

item.title: Grieving mother exposes the truth of Turkey’s deadly earthquake
item.description: After losing her son, Nurgül Göksu set out to investigate how building alterations left his home vulnerable to earthquakes.

item.title: A jailed Imran Khan leaves Pakistan divided ahead of election
item.description: No other politician has caused as many rifts in Pakistan as the cricket star-turned politician.

item.title: Super Bowl 58: Taylor Swift conspiracy theories 'nonsense' - NFL boss Roger Goodell
item.description: Super Bowl conspiracy theories involving Taylor Swift are "nonsense", says NFL commissioner Roger Goodell.

item.title: Is Ireland's productivity boom real or 'artificial'?
item.description: Irelands hosts many multinational companies which makes calculating its true productivity difficult.

item.title: Spanish farmers join wave of protests
item.description: Across Spain, farmers have been protesting at EU regulations and demanding more help from their government.

item.title: Tesla owners told not to wear Apple virtual reality headsets while driving
item.description: Videos have emerged showing people wearing the virtual reality headsets while in self-driving cars.

item.title: Israel-Gaza war: Unknown fate of six-year-old Hind Rajab trapped under fire
item.description: Six-year-old Hind was last heard from trapped in a car surrounded by bodies - then the line went dead.

item.title: RAF employee hid in toilet to escape 'constant' sexual harassment from boss
item.description: Women tell the BBC they quit the air force after being "seen as trouble" for complaining.

item.title: Karolina Shiino: Ukraine-born Miss Japan gives up crown following affair
item.description: The controversial Ukraine-born model has resigned after a report on her relations with a married man.

item.title: Los Angeles: Helicopter crew rescues man from surging river
item.description: The man entered the water to save his dog after it was swept away. The dog managed to swim to safety.

item.title: Police using all resources in hunt for Clapham suspect Abdul Shokoor Ezedi, minister says
item.description: Police continue to search for corrosive liquid attack suspect Abdul Shokoor Ezedi for a sixth day.

item.title: Former Irish PM John Bruton dies aged 76
item.description: Mr Bruton was taoiseach from 1994 to 1997 when he led a rainbow coalition government.

item.title: Online Safety Act not strong enough, Brianna Ghey's mum says
item.description: Esther Ghey says the act does not go far enough to protect children and calls for "drastic action".

item.title: NatWest may 'tell Sid' to buy shares in June
item.description: The firm overseeing the government's stake in the bank may soon begin selling shares to the public.

item.title: Ukraine war: Baby killed in Russian strike on Kharkiv hotel
item.description: A two-month-old boy is killed in the latest cross-border attack on Ukraine's Kharkiv region.

item.title: Jaywick dog attack: Esther Martin will not be forgotten, says son
item.description: Esther Martin, 68, died after being attacked in a home on the Essex coast.

item.title: Taylor Swift reveals new album details as Super Bowl speculation continues
item.description: The popstar announced the release of her 11th album in a Grammy Awards acceptance speech on Sunday.

item.title: Pterosaur: Unique flying reptile soared above Isle of Skye
item.description: The pterosaur soared over the heads of dinosaurs in Scotland 168-166 million years ago.

item.title: Toby Keith: Country music legend dies aged 62
item.description: Toby Keith, one of country music's biggest stars, had previously revealed he had stomach cancer.

item.title: Trent Alexander-Arnold: Liverpool defender discusses life outside football with academy players
item.description: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold speaks to Liverpool academy players about the mental pressures that come with being released by clubs.

item.title: Rishi Sunak says he was taken by surprise on £1,000 Rwanda bet
item.description: Rishi Sunak says he took the bet with Piers Morgan to "underline" his commitment to the Rwanda policy.

item.title: Sheffield: New mum urges HIV testing amid case rise
item.description: Becky has spoken out as official figures show testing for HIV remains below pre-pandemic levels.

item.title: Yandex: Owner of 'Russia's Google' pulls out of home country
item.description: Yandex has previously been accused of hiding information from Russia's public about the Ukraine war.

item.title: NHS Wales: Day-long ambulance wait after care home fall
item.description: The family of Theresa Jones, 91, say she was left on the floor "like a piece of rubbish".

item.title: Scottish comedy 'titans' to star in new BBC Scotland sitcom
item.description: Greg McHugh and Gregor Fisher will play a father and son duo in the BBC Scotland comedy Only Child.

item.title: McDonald's sales dented by Israel-Gaza boycotts
item.description: The chain said its fourth quarter sales failed to meet its target for the first time in four years.

item.title: Clapham attack: Man arrested for allegedly helping Abdul Shokoor Ezedi
item.description: Police say a man was detained and bailed on suspicion of helping Abdul Shokoor Ezedi.

item.title: Jaywick dog attack: Esther Martin's death causes 'terrible shock'
item.description: Jaywick resident Mary Donovan says it is a "terrible shock" for everyone in the coastal village.

item.title: Super Bowl 2024: Patrick Mahomes v Tom Brady - Can Chiefs quarterback be the new GOAT?
item.description: As Patrick Mahomes prepares for his fourth Super Bowl in five years, the big question being raised is could he one day take Tom Brady's mantle as the GOAT of the NFL?

item.title: Mauricio Pochettino: Chelsea boss receives 'good texts' from owners amid pressure
item.description: Chelsea manager Mauricio Pochettino says he has received "good texts" from the club's owners following back-to-back Premier League losses.

item.title: India v England: 'Ben Stokes' team can win if they find a little ruthlessness'
item.description: England have shown they can hang with India in India, but they will need to find some ruthlessness to win the series, says Stephan Shemilt.

item.title: Women's Champions League: Chelsea draw Ajax in quarter-finals
item.description: Chelsea will face Ajax in the quarter-finals of the Women's Champions League and are the only British side still in the competition.

item.title: Inter Milan: 'It will take a miracle to deny Nerazzurri the Serie A title'
item.description: This is by far the best Inter Milan side Italy has seen since Jose Mourinho's 2010 Treble winners, writes Mina Rzouki.

item.title: Six Nations: Richie Gray and Luke Crosbie ruled out of tournament for Scotland
item.description: Lock Richie Gray and back row Luke Crosbie will miss the rest of Scotland's Six Nations campaign after sustaining injuries in the opening win over Wales.

item.title: 'Fury was training like a demon - it's ridiculous to question his cut'
item.description: Promoter Frank Warren says Tyson Fury has been "training like a demon" and it is "ridiculous" to question the legitimacy of the Briton's eye injury.

item.title: King Charles's cancer was 'caught early', Rishi Sunak says
item.description: Prime minister tells the BBC he is in "regular contact" with King Charles III following his diagnosis.

item.title: William, Harry and the other royals - what it means for them
item.description: It's been a bleak midwinter for the Royal Family. Will the King's health news help to bring them together?

item.title: What do we know about the diagnosis?
item.description: King Charles has been diagnosed with cancer, but Buckingham Palace has not said what type it is.

item.title: How the King's duties will change
item.description: The King is stepping back from public duties after being diagnosed with cancer.

item.title: The work that will continue during the King's treatment
item.description: Charles is stepping back from public-facing duties, but his private work continues, BBC political editor Chris Mason writes.

item.title: Prince Harry to fly to UK to visit his father
item.description: The Duke of Sussex spoke to his father about the diagnosis and will travel to the UK to visit him.

item.title: Buckingham Palace statement in full
item.description: Buckingham Palace has announced that King Charles is being treated for a form of cancer.

item.title: Watch BBC News read Palace statement as King's cancer diagnosis announced
item.description: Buckingham Palace has announced that the King is being treated for cancer.

item.title: Cost of living payment: When is it and who gets it?
item.description: Millions of low-income households will receive a final cost of living payment soon.

item.title: Fuel cost: How to save petrol and diesel
item.description: With weak competition adding to fuel prices, are drivers doing the right things to save money?

item.title: Train strikes: All you need to know about action in February and March
item.description: More than 300 London Overground workers will go on strike from midnight on Monday 19 February.

item.title: Energy bills: What can I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: If you're struggling to afford your gas and electricity bills, what options are available?

item.title: National Insurance calculator: What will I pay and how is tax changing?
item.description: National Insurance rates are falling, but other changes mean many people are paying more tax.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: Experts give advice for those who might be worried about their monthly mortgage payments.

item.title: Rent increases: What you can do about a rise from your landlord
item.description: The BBC's Lora Jones tells you four things you can do, if your landlord asks for more money.

item.title: Renting: What are your rights as a tenant?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.

item.title: How to save money even when the budget is tight
item.description: The interest paid on savings is better than anything seen for years, so how can you save when bills are rising?
